panels.description:
**Latch Waits/sec**: 
The number of latches in the last second that had to wait. Latches are lightweight means of holding a very transient server resource, such as an address in memory.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Latch Waits/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Latch Waits/sec

panels.description:
**Page Splits/sec**: 
Monitors the number of page splits per second which occur due to overflowing index pages and should be as low as possible

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Page Splits/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Page Splits/sec

      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Page Deallocations/sec','Pages Allocated/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'

      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.description:
**Lock Requests/ sec**:   *You want <1000*   
The number of new locks and locks converted per second. This metricâ€™s value should generally correspond to "Batch Requests/sec". Values > 1000 may indicate queries are accessing very large numbers of rows and may benefit from tuning

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Lock Requests/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Lock Requests/sec

      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]

  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Page Compression Attempts/sec','Pages Compressed/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.description:
**Lock Timeouts/ sec**:   *You want <1*   
Shows the number of lock requests per second that timed out, including internal requests for NOWAIT locks. A value greater than zero might indicate that user queries are not completing. The lower this value is, the better.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Lock Timeouts/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Lock Timeouts/sec

panels.description:
**Page Splits Rate**:  *You want < 20 %*
Monitors the number of page splits per second which occur due to overflowing index pages and should be as low as possible. To avoid page splits, review table and index design to reduce non-sequential inserts or implement fillfactor and pad_index to leave more empty space per page. NOTE: A high value for this counter is not bad in situations where many new pages are being created, since it includes new page allocations.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Page Splits/sec','Batch Requests/Sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Page Splits Rate

panels.description:
**Full Scans/sec**: 
Monitors the number of full scans on tables or indexes. Ignore unless high CPU coincides with high scan rates. High scan rates may be caused by missing indexes, very small tables, or requests for too many records. A sudden increase in this value may indicate a statistics threshold has been reached, resulting in an index no longer being used.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Full Scans/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Full Scans/sec

panels.description:
**Lock Waits/sec**:   *You want 0 *   
How many times users waited to acquire a lock over the past second. Values greater than zero indicate at least some blocking is occurring, while a value of zero can quickly eliminate blocking as a potential root-cause problem. As with "Lock Wait Time", lock waits are not recorded by PerfMon until after the lock event completes.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Lock Waits/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Lock Waits/sec

  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Page IO latch waits')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.description:
**Index Searches/sec**:    
Monitors the number of index searches when doing range scans, single index record fetches, and repositioning within an index

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Index Searches/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Index Searches/sec

panels.description:
**Avg Wait Time (ms)**:   *You want <500 *   
The average wait time, in milliseconds, for each lock request that had to wait. An average wait time longer than 500ms may indicate excessive blocking. This value should generally correlate to "Lock Waits/sec" and move up or down with it accordingly.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Average Wait Time (ms)')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Average Wait Time

panels.description:
**Number of Deadlocks/sec**:   *You want < 1 *   
Number of lock requests, per second, which resulted in a deadlock. Since only a COMMIT, ROLLBACK, or deadlock can terminate a transaction (excluding failures or errors), this is an important value to track. Excessive deadlocking indicates a table or index design error or bad application design.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Number of Deadlocks/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Number of Deadlocks/sec

panels.description:
**Full Scans Rate**:  *You want < 1in 1000*   
Ratio of *Full Scans/sec* and *Index Searches/sec*
Monitors the number of index searches when doing range scans, single index record fetches, and repositioning within an index. The threshold recommendation is strictly for OLTP workloads.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND counter_name IN ('Full Scans/sec','Index Searches/sec')
  AND [sql_instance] = '$sql_instance'
  GROUP BY [counter_name]
      ,$__timeGroup([report_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

panels.title: Full Scan Rate
